sourceMeaningMnemonic: You want to <radical>change</radical> your <radical>shellfish</radical> into <kanji>freight</kanji> so you can transport it. That means packing them up into giant freight containers.
meaningInfo: Imagine changing your shellfish from loose, wet form, to solid freight form. It's actually a lot of hard work.
readingMnemonic: To move this <kanji>freight</kanji>, you need a <reading>ca</reading>r (<ja>か</ja>). You strap all of the freight containers to the top of your car, stacked nice and high and precarious, so you can move it.
readingInfo: Picture all of this freight stacked on top of your car. As you drive the car, every turn you make feels slow and heavy from the freight weight.
